Bioinformatics University Specialist (UPV/EHU)

Introduction

Bioinformatics is the area that provides informatics tools to analyse the “Big Data” generated by advanced molecular biology technologies. A competent bioinformatician has to trully understand the biological nature of the problems derived from the current “Data tsunami” and has to master the technical skills to develop practical solutions (software, infrastructures, etc.) for the analysis. This degree will provide students with both types of skills, biological knowledge and informatics expertise, and hence will make them able to develop bioinformatics-based technical solutions in academia or companies. Also, the degree will promote the interaction between the students of the different backgrounds.

The degree will be taught 2016-2017. It is a EHU Own Degree leading to a University Specialist certificate.

This is a project by the Genomic Resources research group of the Dpt. of Genetics, Physical Anthropology and Animal Physiology, Sciences and Technology Faculty (ZTF-FCT), University of Basque Country (UPV/EHU).

Entry requirements

Students of scientific and technical backgrounds are encouraged to apply, including professionals. The first half of the programme is divided to provide the appropriate tuition to each student, according to their background: students with a technical background (Computer science, engineering, physics, ...) will be allocated to the Life Sciences path, whereas students with a biomedical background (Biologists, Medical Doctors, biochemists, environmentalists, ...) will be allocated to the Computer Science path (see programme for details).

Students should be fluent in english (the tuition will be provided exclusively in english) and will be selected according to english level, degree adecuacy to the course, degree marks, and CV.
